comment: This professor is very inconsistent. She does not grade until last minute, so do not depend on withdraw being an option. In class we went over things we did in previous classes. I believe she is unaware and uneducated on what she is teaching and assigning the class to do. She is not reliable, and unfair with grading.

She is very inconsistent. She's a nice person, but her expectations are off. It seemed like she didn't know the assignments and gave mixed signals. We went over things we did in 2008, 3316, and 3317 each class, but didn't go over the actual assignments. She was very vague with what she wanted.

MATH3317-She was very kind and wanted everyone to be involved in the lectures. We used a program called GeoGebra and I absolutely hated it, but I do think that was kind of out of her control. There were a good bit of assignments each week, which was kind of frustrating, because they felt pointless.

There are tickets out the door worth 5 points every lecture. They are pretty easy, and she guides you in the right direction if you need help. Pearson homework has unlimited attempts. Tests are a breeze as long as you can do the study guide and go to class.

Moni is one of the best teachers I've had. Her lectures are engaging and easy to follow. She makes an effort to learn everyone's names before the first week of class ends and offers a lot of extra credit. Homework is online and there's an exit ticket at the end of each class. Just show up, pay attention, and do homework early and you'll be good!

She's really nice and encourages us to ask questions. the homework is online and you need to do an exit ticket at the end of every class. make sure you pay attention in class because sometimes she calls on students when we review the work. show up and put in effort and you'll be fine!

She's super nice and made all the concepts very clear. I loved how she made an effort to learn all her student's names. Not only did that make me feel connected to her, but it also connected me to the other people in the class when regularly heard her say them. I definitely recommend her and she's probably the best math teacher I've had in college.

Always willing to help and is very easy to reach, easy A if you use the study guide and attend. Very nice teacher! only downside is that attendance is mandatory, and after 4 unexcused absense you drop a letter grade if so. Other than that amazing class. The class just like all others is weighted on your tests alot.
She is so sweet and always willing to stay late to help!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. McGlone was friendly, but she explained material in a roundabout and overly complicated way. If visualizing with 10-row charts is your jam, this class is for you. If not, stay as far away as possible. If you miss more than three courses, she drops your grade by a letter, and her tests are often far more difficult than the homework problems.

Lectures were all over the place and seemed like she barely knew the material herself. Didn't teach, just read off the powerpoints that were filled with mistakes. NONE of her tests were multiple choice and she's a tough grader. Also you have to complete an exit ticket at the end of every class for a grade.

Took her during fall semester 2022! Overall the class was good. She will help if you need help so don't be afraid to ask! She gave us a study guide for each test and we would have a review day! Some had issues with her class but if you study and review the study guides you will be fine! she's a very chill teacher, I recommend taking her! Theres hw!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Miss Moni is a great teacher. Her class involves a lot of studying if you're not good at math. There are a lot of exit tickets and homework, but the homework is pretty easy. The exit tickets I struggled on, but she always helped me understand the material. During test days, she will check your answers and tell you what's wrong and what's right!

Mrs. McGlone is very caring and sweet.She will answer questions if you need help and she does well explaining the material during class.There were 4 test and exit tickets .YOU HAVE TO STUDY AND USE THE TEXTBOOK FOR PRACTICE! There are study guides for each tests but you should uses the powerpoints/exit tickets as well when studying. Overall easy!

I took this class when it was her first semester teaching it so there were a few rough patches at first but she was a pretty good professor overall. Attendance is mandatory with graded exit tickets every day (two are dropped). She teaches well, gives a decent amount of extra credit / bonuses and the homework is online and very frustrating at times.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I feel bad rating her so low because she's a very sweet woman. However, if you are not good at math, please don't take Quantitative Reasoning with her. You'll do great if your good at math, but if you're bad at math, please take another course. She's very nice and cares about her students, but isn't good at explaining to those who don't get math.

I like professor McGlone. She does care about the students and wants us to succeed but her course was very difficult, not necessarily because of her but the material is hard to learn and there is a lot of it. The homework wasn't too bad and there are multiple attempts but the study guides and the tests do not match up at all. Study hard to pass!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: she was really nice! I struggled a bit in the class but I think she's a pretty good teacher. If you keep up with the homework and study then you should do well.

Professor Moni is really not that bad. Her class is extremely difficult and I have struggled very hard in it but I do not believe she's a bad teacher her teaching style just doesn't work for everyone. Even though I am struggling she still encourages me which makes me feel a little bit better. She also offers extra help if you don't understand.

Professor McGlone is sweet and caring and has a passion for teaching. Yet, she never throughly explains anything and expects you to get it off the bat. The study guide she provides are never similar to the test. You are basically teaching yourself the math. I expected to get a B or an A, but now will be lucky to get a C.

Professor McGlone seems to be a very sweet lady, however her class is far from easy. The study guides do not reflect the material that is given on the tests. She gives exit tickets at the end of class, yet barely any time to do them so we almost always have to stay late to finish. I wouldn't recommend taking this professor if you want a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She was one of my favorite professors and I hate math, but I looked forward to her class and felt comfortable when asking her questions. She was super caring and checks your answers during the test too. You have a week to do your homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: shes amazing. you have math homework thats due a week after a lecture. The tests are easy and she will literally check it before you turn it in. If you do the study guides youll do good on the tests. Every class she has an exit ticket and its part of your grade so go to class. She totals your grade and if it is high enough you exempt the final

GO TO CLASS EASY A. If you dont know anything about math this is worth doing. the only reason people get bad grades in this class is if they dont go. The class is built for freshman and math beginners. She is incredibly generous and you its boring the first few weeks but dont be afraid to ask questions on the exit tickets and you will get an A+ np

She is an amazing teacher, if you don't understand math, register for her class. She is a little sassy when you ask her questions, might give a little attitude, but she teaches in depth and clearly. Just take notes and use them for the homework, she uses the same questions sometimes. If you're not good at math, take detailed notes, they help a lot
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a very good teacher and explains very thoroughly. If you miss one day it might affect you if you don't look over the powerpoint on your own time. every class is a different lesson so try not to miss a class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: I absolutely love professor McGlone! She is very helpful and a very good explainer. If you need help she gets back to you in a timely manner. The attendance is taken by the exit tickets which is based off of each lesson. If you don't show up to class then you can submit the exit ticket through email.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: AMAZING PROFESSOR, A MUST TAKE! I'm not a fan of math, but she made me love coming to class. She's super friendly and made the whole class open up. There are exit tickets, weekly webassign hw, 3 tests, and one final (which you can exempt). Her lectures are easy to understand and she gives out a lot of bonus points.

Definitely not my favorite professor I've had this far at KSU. if you're a boy I'm sure you'll get an A if you're a girl I'm sure you won't :)If you ask questions she pretends you're dumb, and basically just embarrasses you without answering your question. I mean that is her job, right?
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I loved this math class and I am definitely not a math person. She teaches the math and makes sure that everyone understands it. The homework can be challenging but she is always willing to help. You can also ask questions during test. I would recommend going to review sessions before test. They help a lot. Great class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Moni is such a sweet and caring person and a great professor! The way she taught was thorough and easy to understand, always eager to help those who need it as well. Homework assigned after each lecture and due 7 days later. tests at the end of each chapter but gives bonus points for attending review day + option to exempt final exam! Great class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Moni was wonderful! She explained things in a way I could understand and would answer any questions I had. She was not only a great teacher, but she learned her students names individually which was really nice. I feel that she cares about her students on a personal level! Im so glad I got the chance to be in her class.

Fantastic Teacher- incredibly caring and always willing to help. Mandatory attendance- after 3 absences your grade goes down a grade point. Difficult online work but you can text her on the site or in general for any help and she'll reply shortly. Easy tests if use study guide properly. Don't need book. She dealt with the COVID-19 transition well!
Worked my ass off and still made a C. No curve, and definitely has favorites. She will explain stuff on exams sometimes, but once again- favorites. Would not recommend or take her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far one of the best math teachers Ive had so far in my life. I did get a C in her class but that was on me , because of personal issues i was going through. She Always answered my questions throughly and by far a sweet lady. Would take her again!

take her if you can 10/10! she's super patient and willing to teach you. she's great at explaining things so you will do good if you pay attention. you have 4 tests (not hard, not easy), an exit ticket after every class (counts for attendance) and online hw. they're all easy if you take notes and go to class. she is super interactive and personal

Lectures are very straight to the point and easy to follow. She explains each step slowly so that no matter how slow you learn, you can keep up. She's also very caring and empathetic towards her students, and will help them with ALL of their assignments/assessments.

Most of the class is a lecture, works math examples out with you. 2 math assignments a week, 4 tests, including a final. Gave 2 short inspirational talks, and genuinely cares for her students. Best math teacher I have had. Can play on your phone, but don't forget to pay attention to the lecture. 4 absences allowed or you drop a letter grade.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor McGlone was an amazing teacher. She will help anybody and is patient. Her class is in lecture format, but it's not too boring. Homework was online and needs to be done in order to pass the class. Showing up to class was important too. She took attendance by using Exit Tickets, which were also for a grade.

Professor Mcglone is an amazing prof overall! She explains math in a way that is easy for anyone to understand and will gladly answer questions if necessary. She gives exit tickets and homework for every class but drops a few of the exit tickets and the hw is a great extra credit resource! Take her! Shes amazing! I would definitely take her again!

Shes a really great teacher and I didnt have any trouble in her class since most of it was review of high school material. I noticed some of the older students struggling because she moved pretty fast and expected us to be familiar with most of the information. She also gives exit tickets every day so dont skip class. Very easily accessible.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She's a great teacher. Explains content very well. She's understanding and caring! She's very particular on tests, so learn how to be specific! Vey easy to get in contact with. Has homework assignments associated with what we learn in class that are all online. They're pretty simple.

One of the best math teachers I have ever had. Makes class so fun and easy to understand. Is always down to answer any questions. Tests are straightforward, weekly homework but you have a week to do them after every lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome professor! She really makes a math class fun which is hard to do. Cares about every student. Explains the material thoroughly in easy terms and doesn't hesitate to go over something again if someone doesn't understand. Webassign HW every week but it's not long or hard. She assigns exit tickets at the end of class to take attendance. 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: If you like math, take her. If you find math difficult, dont take this class. Youre expected to get the material immediately and any questions asked are treated like dumb questions.
She is a good teacher. But once she is done teaching she expects you to not ask a lot of questions. It was tough and I had to work really hard to make an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: End of each class, you solve "Exit Tickets" which counts for accuracy on content you just learned. Get ready for lots of WebAssign homework. The 3 tests and final are mostly from the study guide with a few tricky problems. If you are struggling, do not be afraid to ask for extra help! Professor M is more than happy to help you outside of class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Test are very difficult and short and gives no partial credit. You are either right or wrong with whatever she assigns. Only has 3 test and a final which is not a lot to improve your grade. Definitely would not recommend taking her.

Mrs. McGlone is a decent teacher. Shes nice and her class is relatively easy. Shes willing to go to each specific student and give help. She does give a graded exit ticket after each class so I wouldn't skip too many. The homework counts as a test grade, so all in all its a pretty easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Would take again
